io.deepstream

Class List

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.deepstream.List

  • public class List
extends java.lang.Object
    A List is a specialised Record that contains an Array of recordNames and provides a number of convinience methods for interacting with them.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      List addEntry(java.lang.String entry)
      Add an entry to the end of the list

      Adds a Listener that will notify you if a Discard, Delete or Error event occurs
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> getEntries()
      Returns the array of list entries or an empty array if the list hasn't been populated yet.

      Return whether the list has been destroyed.

      Returns true if the list is empty

    • Method Detail

      • isReady

        public boolean isReady()
        Return whether the list data has been loaded from the server
        Returns:
        true if record has been loaded

      • isDestroyed

        public boolean isDestroyed()
        Return whether the list has been destroyed. If true and you need to use the method create it again via RecordHandler.getList(String) (String)}
        Returns:
        true if list has been destroyed

      • version

        public int version()
        Return the list version. This is solely used within a RecordMergeStrategy.
        Returns:
        -1 if not loaded, otherwise the local version number

      • name

        public java.lang.String name()
        Return the list name
        Returns:
        The list name

      • addRecordEventsListener

        public List addRecordEventsListener(RecordEventsListener recordEventsListener)
        Adds a Listener that will notify you if a Discard, Delete or Error event occurs
        Parameters:
        recordEventsListener - The listener to add
        Returns:
        The list

      • removeRecordEventsListener

        public List removeRecordEventsListener(RecordEventsListener recordEventsListener)
        Remove listener added via addRecordEventsListener(RecordEventsListener)
        Parameters:
        recordEventsListener - The listener to remove
        Returns:
        The list

      • getEntries

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getEntries()
        Returns the array of list entries or an empty array if the list hasn't been populated yet.
        Returns:
        A List containing all the recordNames

      • setEntries

        public List setEntries(java.util.List<java.lang.String> entries)
        Updates the list with a new set of entries
        Parameters:
        entries - The recordNames to update the list with
        Returns:
        The list

        public List removeEntry(java.lang.String entry)
        Removes the first occurrence of an entry from the list
        Parameters:

        Returns:

        public List removeEntry(java.lang.String entry,
               int index)
        Removes an entry from the list if it resides at a specific index
        Parameters:
        entry - The entry to remove from the list
        index - The index at which the entry should reside at

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns true if the list is empty
        Returns:
        true if this list contains no elements

      • subscribe

        public List subscribe(ListChangedListener listChangedListener,
             boolean triggerNow)
        Notifies the user whenever the list has changed, and notifies immediately if triggerNow is true
        Parameters:
        listChangedListener - The listener to add
        triggerNow - Whether to trigger the listener immediately
        Returns:
        The list
